Package cetus.hir

Class FunctionCall

  • java.lang.Object
    • cetus.hir.Expression
      • cetus.hir.FunctionCall
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Printable, Traversable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Expression>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    KernelFunctionCall
    public class FunctionCall
extends Expression
    Represents a function or method call.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FunctionCall

        public FunctionCall​(Expression function,
                    Expression... args)
        Creates a function call having no arguments.
        Parameters:
        function - An expression that evaluates to a function.
        args - Arguments
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if function is invalid.
        NotAnOrphanException - if function has a parent object.

      • FunctionCall

        public FunctionCall​(Expression function,
                    java.util.List args)
        Creates a function call having a list of arguments.
        Parameters:
        function - An expression that evaluates to a function.
        args - A list of arguments to the function.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if function or an element of args is invalid.
        NotAnOrphanException - if function or an element of args has a parent object.

                                java.io.PrintWriter o)
        Prints a function call to a stream.
        Parameters:
        c - The call to print.
        o - The writer on which to print the call.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the function call. The returned string is equivalent to the printed stream through defaultPrint(cetus.hir.FunctionCall, java.io.PrintWriter).
        Overrides:
        toString in class Expression
        Returns:
        the string representation.

      • hashCode

        protected int hashCode​(int h)
        Description copied from class: Expression
        Returns cumulative hash code with the given initial value, h. This is intended for optimizing memory usage when computing hash code of an expression object. Previous approach constructs a string representation of the expression to get the hash code while this approach uses the same algorithm as String.hashCode() without creating a string. All sub classes of Expression have there specific implementations of this method and Expression.hashCode() simply returns hashCode(0).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Expression

        Returns:

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n is out of range.
